active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a post-database incident scenario where forensics revealed weak encryption (SC-28) and inadequate auditing (AU-6), debate: 'Should organizations prioritize NIST CSF Recover function over SP 800-53 control enhancements for rapid improvement, or vice versa? Support with pros/cons and real-world examples.' Encourage critical thinking by requiring evidence from voter-suggested controls.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards on 'Security Control Improvement' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > 012_Database Security > 012_002_Incident Response and Forensics > 010_Post-Incident Activities > Security Control Improvement). Cover post-incident database security using NIST CSF 2.0 (esp. Respond/Recover for improvements) and NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (focus families: AC e.g. AC-2; AU e.g. AU-6; SC e.g. SC-8, SC-28; applications to encryption, auditing, access post-forensics). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the array above]. Distribute flashcards: 5 Remember/Understand, 10 Apply/Analyze, 10 Evaluate/Create, 5 mixed. - Active Learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving. - Scaffolding: 8 cards/Layer1, 8/Layer2, 8/Layer3, 6/Layer4. Include concept map nodes as prompts. - Voter Consensus: 67.1% approval; emphasize completeness on SP 800-53, database specifics. - Research: Security controls as safeguards; CSF risk-based outcomes; SP 800-53 control catalog. Use exact Flashcard Schema: Output as JSON array of 30 objects. Ensure university pedagogy: Bloom's progression, active recall, scaffolding. No adult/offensive content.
